featured.text: In winter, our skin tends to become dry and _____, a problem which is usually treated by applying lotions or creams.
Secondly, as people are drawn into the story, they tend to take the perspective of the characters and rehearse the plot unconsciously.
Such dimples tend to occur in families, and are assumed to be an inherited feature.
Boys tend to pay less attention in class than girls.

other.text: Before a match is made, potential swappers tend to discuss a lot.
30 , they tend to believe criticism to be suggestion for improvement.
According to the passage, the first child tends to be __________.
When the weather is bad, individuals tend to focus more on their work rather than thinking about activities they could 29 outside of work.
They tend to stand or move around less on days they work out.
Also, the idea 30 a very complex issue regarding depression into something simple and easily understandable, and that tends to appeal to a lot of people. 26.
People in this community tend to _____ with the group they belong to, and often put group interests before personal ones.
Younger children tend to remain forever “the baby,” enjoyable to be around, but at times overdependent on others.
This may help explain why younger children tend to favor the creative fields such as music, art, and writing.
People wearing the physical smile tend to feel happier.
As is often observed, most of us tend to associate lower notes with darker colors and higher notes with brighter colors.
The problem with Jane is that she tends to take criticism too and gets angry easily.
Research suggests that people with outgoing personalities tend to be more _____, often expecting that good things will happen.

definition.zh_def: 照顧；傾向於某種行為或狀態
definition.en_def: To take care of or look after; to have a tendency or inclination towards something.
definition.example: She tends to her garden every morning.
